Primary_Text: Rabbit falo ki bam nɔs doy a faze race.
Translated_Text: The rabbit said: "Come, the two of us will make a race."

Primary_Text: El hal-o el lə ʋi puris.
Translated_Text: He said that he would come.

Primary_Text: Lʋidz hal-o el lə ʋi amya.
Translated_Text: Lwidz said he would come tomorrow.

Primary_Text: yo hal-o ki "irmãʋ, mi kɔs su tɛ."
Translated_Text: I said "brother you are younger than me" (lit. I said "brother you are in back of me").

Primary_Text: tɔɔna eev ɔɔntotardiiya jaapuntaa, boos jaafalaavoo ricedntaa falaatu
Translated_Text: Then the day before yesterday I asked [him], “Did you tell Richard?”

Primary_Text: avara osiyoor taam [nɔɔyvantaa] lopuntaa, "boospa  teen dizeey voo, elipa pakazaa?"  falaatu
Translated_Text: Now he [the priest] will also ask [the bride], "are you willing to marry him?"

Primary_Text: nikara   falaa  jafalaatu     noos  mee rebekaantu   jalaraa   tem
Translated_Text: Saying "Don't [go to the convent]" it was we who took left [her] at Rebecca's.

Primary_Text: keem, keensu   fiiya,   keem falaatu   mesfalaa
Translated_Text: [They] must say who [you are], and whose daughter [you are], who [you are]. (i.e. They must know who you are and whose daughter you are.)

Primary_Text: yo ja falá eli ta bai
eli falá ki isi, tudo angkoza, ta subí presu
Translated_Text: He/she used to say that this, everything, is rising in price.

Primary_Text: [...] fala kung ile ki eo dja teng aki [...].
Translated_Text: [...] tell him that I have been here [...].

Primary_Text: [...] pára hablá ki lótro ta na álta sosyedád.
Translated_Text: [...] to say that they are in the high society.

Primary_Text: Ya hablá Tʃéri no éle di pwéde trabahá.
Ta habla mi hermano que frio daw el agua.
Translated_Text: My brother says that the water is cold.

Primary_Text: Ay-ablá yo kunéle (kay) nuáy yo sen.
Translated_Text: I will tell him/her that I don't have money.

Primary_Text: No ta asina ku bo por bisa ku mi tin un kolekshon di sombré.
Translated_Text: You can't really say that I have a hat collection.

Primary_Text: Hendenan ku ta biba a lo largu di Kaya Korona ta puntra nan mes ku si no tin polis mas riba kaya ku ta mira e kosnan aki sosodé.
Translated_Text: People who live around Kaya Korona are asking themselves whether there aren't any police officers on the streets anymore who see these things happen.

Primary_Text: Asta tabatin fanátiko ku tabata grita ku mester but e organisashon di rèfrinan pa esaki.
Translated_Text: There were even some fanatics who were shouting that the organisation of referees should be fined for this.

Primary_Text: E ta bisa e suegu e ta bai pos bai laba paña.
Translated_Text: She says to her father-in-law she is going to the well to wash the clothes.

Primary_Text: Ele a kondá-mi ke ané asé ta bibí en Benesuela aola.
Translated_Text: He/she told me that they are now living in Venezuela.

Primary_Text: Ané a mensioná ke ese chimme sibirí nu.
Translated_Text: They mentioned that this gadget doesn't work.

Primary_Text: Ou di m w al ak Yv.
Translated_Text: You tell me you went with Yves.

Primary_Text: Manman m di m konsa m a kapab leve on sak san liv lè m a gen kenz an.
Translated_Text: My mother told me like this that I would be able to lift a sack of one hundred pounds when I would be fifteen years old.

Primary_Text: Anplwaye yo di kareman yo p ap travay pou chikèt monnen sa a.
Translated_Text: The employees declared categorically that they wouldn't work for this paltry sum of money.

Primary_Text: Yo di ke y ap tiye l kanmenm.
Translated_Text: They said that they'd kill him anyway.

Primary_Text: ou ka di yo pa'a ni tan travay
Translated_Text: You say that they don't have time to work.

Primary_Text: Yo di-y konha nou kay bengné nou.
Translated_Text: They said to him we would take a bath.

Primary_Text: I di-mwen konmkwa i pé ké la jòd-la.
Translated_Text: He told me that he would not be there today.

Primary_Text: Jan di-mwen ki i ka pati.
Translated_Text: Jan told me that he left.

Primary_Text: Mo di li s te en ti job mo te fè apré lekòl.
Translated_Text: I told him this was a little job I did after school.

Primary_Text: Me Lapen, to di Bouki te p ale jwe.
Translated_Text: But Rabbit, you said that Bouki was not going to play.

Primary_Text: Y a di twa le fil nanye se pwazon.
Translated_Text: They'll tell you that a spider's web is poison.

Primary_Text: Mo pa sèlman touche li, la l ole manti kote la lwa di ki mo konyen li, mo mo ensilte li.
Translated_Text: I didn't even touch him, and now he wants to lie to the police and say that I hit him, that I insulted him.

Primary_Text: Ye di piti-ye se sòti dan dechou, ye te tronpe nouzòt.
Translated_Text: They said children came from cabbages, they tricked us.

Primary_Text: Mé la di azot ki falé pa manzé sitrouy la.
Translated_Text: But she told them that they should not eat that pumpkin.

Primary_Text: [...] mi di i falé trap le ra, falé manzé.
Translated_Text: [...] I say you should have caught the rat, you should have eaten it.

Primary_Text: mo ti dir ki li ena rezoṅ
Translated_Text: I said that she was right.

Primary_Text: mo ti dir li ena rezoṅ
Be nou bann kanmarad lontan in dir ek nou pourdir dan tan lesklavaz Madanm Marsan ti touy touy dimoun [...].
Translated_Text: But for a long time, our friends have told us that during slavery Mrs. Marsan killed people [...].

Primary_Text: Ou a dir ou al Dyego.
Translated_Text: You will say that you go to Diego (Garcia).

Primary_Text: Seselwa, les mwan dir zot ki sitiasyon i bokou pli konplike ki sa.
Translated_Text: Seychelles people, let me tell you that the situation is much more complicated than this.

Primary_Text: Eski zot komans konpran letan mon dir i mank en eleman prensipal dan son bidze?
Translated_Text: Do you start to understand when I say that an important element is lacking in his budget?

Primary_Text: Mon dir li pourdir nou pou al Bamberg demen.
Translated_Text: I tell her that we will go to Bamberg tomorrow.

Primary_Text: Mon dir li ki fodre i retournen dizer.
Translated_Text: I tell her/him that she/he has to return by 10 pm.

Primary_Text: Papa in dir i bezwen retournen.
Translated_Text: Daddy said that he (himself or another person) has to return.

Primary_Text: la ndi kom sa ke la vja
sa ndi ke la ʃa:ti, fam-la
Translated_Text: They say that the woman is nice (Lit. They say that she is nice, that woman).

Primary_Text: Yandi tuba nde: beto ata kutana mbasi.
Translated_Text: He/She said: We will meet tomorrow.

Primary_Text: ndamba aga atene, tere na aunji awe
Translated_Text: Rabbit said, "Spider has hidden himself." OR: Rabbit said that Spider had hidden himself.

Primary_Text: tona mo si ka, si lo hunda mo, atene, mo o, mo nyon' nyen'
Translated_Text: When you arrive there and he asks you what you would like to drink, [...] OR: When you arrive there and he asks "What do you want to drink?"

Primary_Text: mo tene ka na mama ka, mo tene, aa ba ndo ni ake nzoni ape
Translated_Text: Tell your mother over there that the place is not good.

Primary_Text: lo hunda lo, lo tene, kogara, ala ga?!
Translated_Text: He asked her, "Mother-in-law, so you've come?!"

Primary_Text: kogara ni aga awe so, ahunda lo, atene, kogara, mo ke nyon' ye?!
Translated_Text: When his mother-in-law had come, he asked her, "Mother-in-law would you like something to drink?!"

Primary_Text: zo wa la atene mo ga zo wa?
Translated_Text: Who was it who told you to come?

Primary_Text: ago tene na Susu ni atene [...]
Translated_Text: He then said to the Fish [...].

Primary_Text: i tene lakwe que kobela ti bilharzie so ake wara ni gi na lege ti ngu
Translated_Text: We always say that this liver-fluke disease gets us through water.
She said that it was going to rain.
She said it was going to rain.

Primary_Text: Yena chenile lo fana yena gula.
Translated_Text: She said that the boy was ill. OR: She said the boy is ill.
They say: "Haa, we should give you work, we!"
You say that he has been bewitched.

Primary_Text: nas Kakwá kúlu gal úmun Núbi
Translated_Text: All the Kakwa claim they are Nubi.
He said that he would come.

Primary_Text: ána biásalu mara tai kelí rákabu samága de
Translated_Text: I ask my wife to cook the fish.

Primary_Text: yesúa kélim le úo gale ya zakéo
úo gále úo kan ázu bakʃíʃ to
Translated_Text: He said that he wanted his tip.

Primary_Text: Ja gavari, zimlia rabotaj nada, iwo ne panimaj.
Translated_Text: I tell him that we ought to work the land, but he does not understand it.

Primary_Text: Zawtəra, adnaka, sio liudi fanza xadi, tibe səkaʒi: Liudi, ʒimlia rabotaj nada.
Translated_Text: Tomorrow you definitely have to visit people's houses and say: People, you have to cultivate the land! OR : Tomorrow you have to come to each house and urge people to start farming.

Primary_Text: Go  abiilang  dia Americaring   edatang    kəta.
Translated_Text: I know that he has come from America.

Primary_Text: Ah  dua olang  dia cakap  mao lawan siapa busat ah siapa busat.
Translated_Text: These two, they said they wanted to fight (compete) [to find out] who was bigger.

Primary_Text: Bilang kang par dia, kata tado-tado sadiki.
Translated_Text: Tell it to him, that [he should be] quiet a bit.

Primary_Text: De carita dong mau baku-pukol deng Kes.
Translated_Text: He said they would fight Monkey.

Primary_Text: Dia parlente kata de su bayar.
Translated_Text: He lied that he had already paid.

Primary_Text: mən     ama      namban        mariakənan        patn      awrikən     mariak
Translated_Text: He told me to get betelnut.

Primary_Text: Oe olelo wau like pu baby.
Translated_Text: You said that I'm like a baby.

Primary_Text: Pehea oe kamailio oe hele moemoe?
Translated_Text: Why did you say that you were going to sleep?

Primary_Text: X bin tok im til yapakayi.
Translated_Text: X said that he is still small.
I said that you should come.

Primary_Text: pegashka dizin dizindu ke boskunaga ke boskunallacha komingichi
Translated_Text: They say he hit them saying that you, that you just eat.
He said that the dog was big.
"She will be well with us", she said.
She said that she was leaving.
He admitted that he did it.
I told him directly I wouldn't lend him money.
He says he does not know.

Primary_Text: A hatie mie, mie no ben sabie datie joe no ben dé boen.
Translated_Text: I'm sorry that I didn't know that you were not well.

Primary_Text: A no ben sab' taki na wan bigi Anansi.
Translated_Text: He did not know that this was a grown-up Anansi.

Primary_Text: Di mi si dati a susu no e fiti mi, mi tyari en go kenki.
Translated_Text: When I realized that the shoes didn't fit me, I went and exchanged them.

Primary_Text: Mi bribi a man gwe na Holland volgens mi, yere.
Translated_Text: I believe he’s gone to Holland.
I know that it is not good.
I know it is not good.

Primary_Text: Mi sabi kaba taki a libi fu den taanga.
Translated_Text: I already know that their life is difficult.

Primary_Text: mi biliiv si di piknii ded
Translated_Text: I believed that the child had died.

Primary_Text: yu naa noo eniibadii kyan kom kom nak yu dong de?
Translated_Text: Don't you know that anybody can come and knock you down there?

Primary_Text: Hi no da hou shi sik.
Translated_Text: He knows that she is ill.
He knows that she is ill.
He knows that she is ill.
He knows that she is ill.

Primary_Text: Mi nuo se yu tek mi wan degedege fish.
Translated_Text: I know that you took my only fish.

Primary_Text: Mi nuo Ø yu neva tek op di sitn.
Translated_Text: I know (that) you didn't take up the thing.

Primary_Text: A wan mek im now dat wɛn a gaan dat dey kant du dat.
Translated_Text: I'll let him know that they can't do that when I'm gone.

Primary_Text: I me now i hafu paas wan plantedj we wan pu man liv.
Translated_Text: He knew that he had to pass by a small farm where a poor man lived.

Primary_Text: Unu nuo se dehn kaal mi?
Translated_Text: Did you know they called for me?

Primary_Text: An di daata nuo se da neva ihn muma.
Translated_Text: And the daughter knew that it wasn’t her mother.

Primary_Text: Ai doun waa dem nou se Ai tiif di ring.
Translated_Text: I don’t want them to know I stole the ring.

Primary_Text: Yu wud nuo dat Kriol iz laik dis.
Translated_Text: You would know that Creole is like this.

Primary_Text: I think that one his arm is broken.
Translated_Text: I think that one of his arms is broken.

Primary_Text: These children today can’t believe say you could be twelve years old and be a monitress.
Translated_Text: Children today can’t believe that one could be only twelve years old [but already work as an assistant teacher].

Primary_Text: I remember say I done left light on.
Translated_Text: I remember I left the light on.

Primary_Text: I know say the bill only $4.00.
Translated_Text: I know the bill is/was only four dollars.

Primary_Text: I believe they going to Canada or United States.
Translated_Text: I think they're going to Canada or to the United States.

Primary_Text: Den dey gwine know say wa dey beena do ain right.
Translated_Text: Then they are going to know that what they have been doing is not right. (2 Tm 2.26)

Primary_Text: I know they is the relation.
Translated_Text: I know they are the relatives.

Primary_Text: a no se di titi lɛk mi
Translated_Text: I know that the girl likes me.

Primary_Text: demɔkrasi wì tiŋk se ì bi bad tin; nɔt no ì bi gud
Translated_Text: We thought that democracy was a bad thing. (We did) not know that it was good.

Primary_Text: jù no se nɔmali wì dè bai ʃip [...] kil àm
Translated_Text: You know that usually we buy a sheep and kill it.
I know that they went to town.

Primary_Text: Robert sabi se Mary bin sik.
Translated_Text: Robert knows that Mary was ill.

Primary_Text: À no se è dè kil dì fɔl.
Translated_Text: I know that he's killing the fowl.

Primary_Text: You savvy pricee hap go down?
Translated_Text: Do you know that the price has come down?

Primary_Text: Do you know that Sri Devi went back to India?
Translated_Text: Do/Did you know that Sri Devi went back to India?

Primary_Text: I didn't know he had two wives.
Translated_Text: I didn't know he had two wives.

Primary_Text: Ol i save se papa bilong ol i no bilong ples bilong mi.
Translated_Text: They knew that their father was not from my village.

Primary_Text: Klostu taim em bai dai tasol ol man no bin save ol bai mekim wonem.
Translated_Text: It was close to the time he would die, but the people didn't know what they would do.

Primary_Text: Oli save se wanem we gavman hemi mekem ino stret.
Translated_Text: They know that what the government is doing is wrong.

Primary_Text: mi harem olsem mi sore long pikinini ia
Translated_Text: I felt like I was sorry for the child.

Primary_Text: mi save man ia i nogud nating
Translated_Text: I know that man's completely awful.

Primary_Text: all black man savey, no kidnapping now
Translated_Text: Melanesians know that there's no kidnapping now.

Primary_Text: I moosa ell shame fer think I vote some o' yorlye een.
Translated_Text: I am almost ashamed to think I voted some of you guys in.
He knows how to fight back.

Primary_Text: [...] fodima ju wēt, mi ha fo jet oka.
Translated_Text: [...] because you know that I have too eat too.

Primary_Text: Am no wēt se fo kōk jamus fo gurí.
Translated_Text: He did not know that he had to cook yamus in order to grow.

Primary_Text: ɛk ni bi dato jɛ daŋ kanɛ bi mja di laʃɛkaŋ
Translated_Text: I didn't know that it was there, that (it) was lashing out at me.
They knew that I would come to Mona's.

Primary_Text: ɛk ni waŋ di man korja ka
Translated_Text: I don't know where the man was working.

Primary_Text: Sy weet dat Jan siek is.
Translated_Text: She knows that John is ill.
She knows that he is ill.

Primary_Text: Djon sabe ma Maria sta duenti.
Translated_Text: John knows that Mary is ill.

Primary_Text: Nhos sabe ma ten txeu animal ki ê más spértu ki algen?
Translated_Text: Do you know that there are a lot of animals who are more intelligent than people?

Primary_Text: Es sabe ma na kel tenpu, es tinha ses kazinha.
Translated_Text: They know that during that time, they had their house.
You know it is his godson.

Primary_Text: El sabê kma vida e difisil.
Translated_Text: She knows that life is difficult.

Primary_Text: N sibi kuma bu sta li.
Translated_Text: I know that you are here.

Primary_Text: N sebé kumá i na beŋ.
Translated_Text: I know that he will come.
I know that he will come.

Primary_Text: Ê na ta sêbê kuma kwa sa pe dê fa.
Translated_Text: He didn’t know that it was his father.

Primary_Text: A na ta sêbê ku ê sa mwala.
Translated_Text: They didn’t know that it was a woman.

Primary_Text: [...] punda bô sêbê non ska deya-deya kwa se.
Translated_Text: [...] because you know we desire it.

Primary_Text: [...] n vatxê ma ê bê r'ê.
[...] alê [...] na ta ma ê tha Têtêuga me ki tha bisiru pena situ e thêka êndê turu kwa si ma ê thêka fa.
Translated_Text: [...] the king [...] didn't know that it was Turtle himself who was covered with these feathers, hearing all what he was saying.

Primary_Text: [...] jingantxi n'umatu sêbê ya Mene bii poto.
Translated_Text: [...] the giant in the bushes knew that Mene had opened the door.

Primary_Text: [...] pa ê podi sêbê a sa ke foka li.
Translated_Text: […] for him to know that they were going to hang him.

Primary_Text: Fo desyise nge tudu sé fa bibi na sa patu d'ogó-f.
Translated_Text: Since then everybody knows that bibi is not a jungle bird.

Primary_Text: M’ kele fa i ske bi odyiai.
Translated_Text: I think that he will come today.

Primary_Text: Yo sabiŋ ki el tə fala Liza mem.
Translated_Text: I knew that he would say LIZA.

Primary_Text: Yo sab ki ʋɔ parmi lə mustra puris.
Translated_Text: I know that you will show me.

Primary_Text: Elo sab ki yo lə ʋi.
Translated_Text: They know that I will come.
I don't know where he is working.
Does he know what he did?

Primary_Text: noos  nukusaba  eli       batikalontu    tiɲa    falaatu
Translated_Text: We did not know he was in Batticaloa.
Don't you know Ravindran is there?
I know that he is here.

Primary_Text: Isti belu da sabe kung ile ki esta teng lugar [...].
Translated_Text: The old man told him that this was the place [...].

Primary_Text: Mánga protestánti sábi ke ta bíbu Hesús.
Translated_Text: Protestants know that Jesus is alive.

Primary_Text: Sabe mi hermano que frio el agua.
Translated_Text: My brother knows that the water is cold.

Primary_Text: Sábe silá kay ay-bené le légu.
Translated_Text: They know that she will come later.
They know that (s)he will come soon.

Primary_Text: Mi sa kuantu esfuerso i sodó tin tras di un sombré outéntiko di Panamá.
Translated_Text: I know how much effort and sweat goes into an authentic Panama hat.

Primary_Text: Mi sa ku e ta keda insistí te ora ku mi bisa ‘si’.
Translated_Text: I know that she will insist until I say 'yes'.

Primary_Text: I no lubidá ku ‘junkfood’ ta mas barata tambe ku alimento salú.
Translated_Text: And don't forget that junkfood is also cheaper than healthy food.

Primary_Text: ¿Bo sabé-ba nu ke ele ta-ba enfemmo?
Translated_Text: Did you not know that he/she was ill?

Primary_Text: Nou konnen ou nan konplo. Pito w pale!
Translated_Text: We know that you participate in a conspiracy. You had better confess!

Primary_Text: Nou konnen ke ou nan konplo.
Translated_Text: We know that you are participating in a conspiracy.

Primary_Text: Dayè ou pa menm konnen ki nèg ke nèg la ye.
Translated_Text: Moreover you don't even know who that man is.

Primary_Text: fò savé kè sa ki ni sé kè la lari té baré
Translated_Text: You should know that what happened was that the street was blocked there.

Primary_Text: Mo cré to té di mouen to boi la rosé on zerbe.
Translated_Text: I thought you told me that you drank the dew on the grass.

Primary_Text: Mo konne ye te gen chovaz ki res isi.
Translated_Text: I know there were Indians who lived here.

Primary_Text: Mi kone k li la per.
Translated_Text: I know that he/she is afraid.

Primary_Text: Marmay lé kontan [...] i koné pa sa i manz de mounn sa.
Translated_Text: The children are happy [...] they do not know that he eats people.

Primary_Text: mo kóne li en kúyoṅ — *?Róber kóne Mári malád
Translated_Text: I know he's a fool. — NOT: Robert knows Mary is ill.

Primary_Text: zot kone li en pe eṅsinifyaṅ li koṅtaṅ kriye
Translated_Text: They know that he is quite an annoying person, he likes to cry.

Primary_Text: I mal, i konnen pourdir sa dizef pa pour son fanm, si femel i konnen sa dizef pa pour li!
Translated_Text: The male, he knows that these eggs are not those of his mate, if it is the female, she knows (that) these eggs are not hers.

Primary_Text: Si femel i konnen sa dizef pa pour li!
Translated_Text: If it is the female she knows (that) these eggs are not hers.

Primary_Text: Pa konnen pourdir i pe mor, i 'n mor.
Translated_Text: One didn't know whether he was going to die, (but) he died.

Primary_Text: Mon konnen ki zot pe donn zot maksimonm.
Translated_Text: I know that you give your maximum.

Primary_Text: Mon konnen ki papa i kot lakour.
Translated_Text: I know that Daddy is at home.

Primary_Text: (...) i konnen pourdir sa dizef pa pour son fanm
Translated_Text: (...) He knows that these eggs are his mate's.

Primary_Text: Ler ou konnen in ganny set zour, la ou ankese.
Translated_Text: When you know that seven days are over, then you put [the eggs] into boxes.

Primary_Text: (...) dan tou sa ki nou fer mon konnen Seselwa i annan sa kapasite pour fer li byen (...)
Translated_Text: (...) in everything that we do, I know that the Seychelles people have this capacity to make it good (...)

Primary_Text: ma kone ke ta vja nde la-mba
Translated_Text: I know that you come from over there.

Primary_Text: ta pa kone ke se mater pu peti-la?
Translated_Text: Don't you know that she is the mother of the small child?

Primary_Text: lo hinga atene ni eke wali
Translated_Text: She knows that she's a woman.

Primary_Text: mbi ma atene mo mu koli ka
Translated_Text: I hear that you got married over there.

Primary_Text: i hinga ake yi ti mbito mingi
Translated_Text: We know that it is a terrible thing.

Primary_Text: mbi ma tongana mo mu koli ape?
Translated_Text: Haven't I heard that you got married?
I know that you were at home.
I know you were at home.
I know that he is a fool. OR: I know he's foolish.

Primary_Text: ómun áruf gal fí difan-á al gi-já
Translated_Text: They know that there are guests who are coming.
They know how to read the Quran.

Primary_Text: fi nas bifékir ínu ma kwes rája be ída áʃara
Translated_Text: There are people who think that it’s not good to come back empty-handed.

Primary_Text: biníya de ma biárufu gále jamá de gekabasu úo
Translated_Text: The girl doesn’t know that they betray her.

Primary_Text: úo árifu fi móya fi mahál al gowanyát gekóre
Translated_Text: He knew that there was water at the place where the frogs were croaking.

Primary_Text: anína biágder árif hája de batál wa hája dak kwes
Translated_Text: We can know that this is bad and that is good.

Primary_Text: Tibe znaj udege nikada ni plati.
Translated_Text: You know that Udihe never pay.
We knew that it would be so.

Primary_Text: Go biçaya  dia  Americaring   edatang   kəta.
Translated_Text: I think that he came from America.

Primary_Text: Ini orang tahu dia gemuk dia pigi beli satu buku.
Translated_Text: This man, knowing he is fat, he went to buy a book.

Primary_Text: Ham nai jano u-loŋ skul paro ki nai.
Translated_Text: I didn't know if they'd been to school or not.

Primary_Text: Wau manao oe kolohe kela lio wau.
Translated_Text: I think you injured my horse.

Primary_Text: Wau ike iaia noho ma Hulaia.
Translated_Text: I know that he lives in Hulaia.

Primary_Text: Yu nou wen yu warrkap nyanawu Dagaragungka.
Translated_Text: You know when you danced at Daguragu that time.
I do not know when John will come.
I don't know that John has come.

Translated_Text: We repeat it all for you.

Translated_Text: A certain new girl came to school.

Primary_Text: lo mu ato na kogara ti lo ni
Translated_Text: He gave it (the meat) to be prepared for his mother-in-law.

Primary_Text: amu mafuta ti zo ni amu na lo
Translated_Text: He gave her (his mother-in-law) the fatty meat of a human being.

Primary_Text: lo mu samba, lo mu na lo
toon' lo mu na mo samba, mo nyon' pepe
Translated_Text: If he gives you beer, don't drink it.

Primary_Text: amu nyama ti zo so ato amu na lo
Translated_Text: He gave the meat (to his wife) to prepare for her (the girl's mother). OR: He took this human flesh and had it prepared and given to her (the mother).

Primary_Text: ala mu ngombe ti mbi na mbi
gango ti ni la ni ga so
Translated_Text: (She said), "This is my arrival (coming)." OR: This arrival just now is my arrival; What you see is my arrival.

Primary_Text: ba koli ti mbi so mbi yi ti mu lo so la lo ga awe so
Translated_Text: See my man I want to marry who has just come.

Primary_Text: gongo so mbi gwe so, mbi wara lo na lege
Translated_Text: When I was going, I met her/him on the path.

Primary_Text: Lo John na lo Jane yena hambile Thegwin.
Translated_Text: John and Jane went to Durban. OR: John went with Jane to Durban. OR:  John went to Durban with Jane.

Translated_Text: The same cows slept there in the house.

Primary_Text: Semalam cikgu kasi dia satu buku.

Primary_Text: Dia kata pigi tengok dia tak ada nampak ini puanpuan ada tarik ini anjing.

Primary_Text: Diaorang selalu datang sini cari murah punya barang makan-makan, pakai-pakai semainlah.

Primary_Text: Teacher	panggil, kita	 pergi	 tolong tolong sama dia.

Primary_Text: Lu tengok pergi sana lah ah?
Translated_Text: Will you go there and look [at it]?

Primary_Text: Saya	kecil	punya 	lama ah 	ada orang 	jahat ah 	lawan-lawan.
Translated_Text: Long ago when I was young, there were bad people fighting all the time.

Primary_Text: Pada saat orang dalam susa, dong pi belanja di toko.

Primary_Text: Akolu pake wau aha ma kela hale, makou limalima kela rumi, Aiau kela hale.

Primary_Text: Wau lohe no kani [...] wau holoi lole kela manawa.
